xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates
Class Average

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunction<Number,Number>
      xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates.Average
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Average
extends AggregationFunction<Number,Number>

Estimates iteratively the average of given numerical data without any error control. In contrast to aggregation functions provided by ConfidenceAggregationFunction objects of this class don't compute confidence intervals for processed data. The average itself is computed iteratively, i.e. the data is successively consumed and the current average is computed with the 'old' average and the new data element.

Objects of this type are recommended for the usage with aggregator cursors!


Generally, each aggregation function must support a function call of the following type:
agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next),
where agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps and next the next object to use for computation. An aggregation function delivers only null as aggregation result as long as the aggregation function has not yet fully initialized.
Consider the following example: 
 Aggregator aggregator = new Aggregator(
                new DiscreteRandomNumber(new JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper(100), 50), // input-Cursor
                new Average()                   // aggregate function
        );
 <\code><\pre>
 

 A more detailed coverage of online aggregation is given in [HHW97]: P. Haas, J. Hellerstein, 
 H. Wang. Online Aggregation. 1997.








See Also:

Method Detail







invoke


public Number invoke(Number average,
                     Number next)




Two-figured function call for supporting aggregation by this function.
 Each aggregation function must support a function call like agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next),
 where agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f
 the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps
 and next the next object to use for computation.
 This method delivers only null as aggregation result as long as the aggregation
 has not yet initialized.





Specified by:
invoke in class AggregationFunction<Number,Number>






Parameters:
average - result of the aggregation function in the previous computation step
next - next number used for computation

Returns:
aggregation value after n steps










main


public static void main(String[] args)




The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage
 and the functionality of this class.





Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to
                submit parameters when the main method is called.
